Rule: RSA
Line: If you use a third\-party tool, such as ssh\-keygen, to create an RSA key pair, it generates the private key in the OpenSSH key format\. When you connect to your instance, if you use the private key in the OpenSSH format to decrypt the password, you'll get the error `Private key must begin with "-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----" and end with "-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----"`\.

details.name:
Credential in plaintext?

Rule: RSA
Line: If you use a third\-party tool, such as ssh\-keygen, to create an RSA key pair, it generates the private key in the OpenSSH key format\. When you connect to your instance, if you use the private key in the OpenSSH format to decrypt the password, you'll get the error `Private key must begin with "-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----" and end with "-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----"`\.

Commit: .
details.contextText: If you use a third\-party tool, such as ssh\-keygen, to create an RSA key pair, it generates the private key in the OpenSSH key format\. When you connect to your instance, if you use the private key in the OpenSSH format to decrypt the password, you'll get the error `Private key must begin with "-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----" and end with "-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----"`\.
details.snippetText: If you use a third\-party tool, such as ssh\-keygen, to create an RSA key pair, it generates the private key in the OpenSSH key format\. When you connect to your instance, if you use the private key in the OpenSSH format to decrypt the password, you'll get the error `Private key must begin with "-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----" and end with "-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----"`\.

findings.title: Credential in plaintext? Rule: Env Var Line: The default installation of the MariaDB server has several features that are great for testing and development, but they should be disabled or removed for production servers\. The mysql\_secure\_installation command walks you through the process of setting a root password and removing the insecure features from your installation\. Even if you are not planning on using the MariaDB server, we recommend performing this procedure\. Commit: .

details.contextText: The default installation of the MySQL server has several features that are great for testing and development, but they should be disabled or removed for production servers\. The mysql\_secure\_installation command walks you through the process of setting a root password and removing the insecure features from your installation\. Even if you are not planning on using the MySQL server, we recommend performing this procedure\.
details.snippetText: The default installation of the MySQL server has several features that are great for testing and development, but they should be disabled or removed for production servers\. The mysql\_secure\_installation command walks you through the process of setting a root password and removing the insecure features from your installation\. Even if you are not planning on using the MySQL server, we recommend performing this procedure\.
